plotscript.title: Additional Platform Script Commands
plotscript.introduction: These commands are of no use except in the Steam and Console ports of the OHRRPGCE so are documented separately.

command.description:
Set the text shown below a user in the friends list, on Steam or Blackbox. You can't actually set the text directly, instead a list of strings needs to be provided externally, each of which has a token name like "Battling" and a list of localizations (probably just English).
token name is the ID of a string.
substitution is optional, the ID of a string to substitute into the token text, such as the name of the current map. On Blackbox, %s will be substituted. On Steam, %subvalue% will be substituted.
On Steam: Don't include '#' in the token name, it's prepended automatically.
To see the current rich presence status, go to
but beware there's a long lag before it updates. You can test in this way without providing a rich presence localization file needed to actually use this command in a game. See .

Get a platform info string. Currently only Blackbox has any.
dest is the ID of the string in which to put the result.
key is the ID of a string containing a key such as "SYS" or "ASIABUTTONS".
If the value can be converted to an integer (like "1") then it is also converted and returned for convenience. Otherwise the return value is 0.
For testing, key-value pairs can be placed in gamename_config.ini next to the .rpg, or in ohrrpgce_config.ini, in the form env.key=value, e.g. env.SYS=PS4. Available keys include:
SYS - one of: XBOXONE, PS4, PSVITA, WINDOWS, SWITCH, PS5, SERIESX
ASIABUTTONS - one of "0" or "1". If "1", confirm is circle and cancel is cross (Nintendo or by user preference on PS).
REGION - may be empty, or may be NA, EU, JP, depending on the game.
GAMERTAG - the currently logged in profile's name (Xbox One).

section.title: Blackbox
section.description: These commands are only useful in Ratalaika's OHRRPGCE port to consoles (aka Blackbox). But they exist and can be called in any OHRRPGCE port, doing nothing.

command.description: Call at the actual beginning of a New Game, not a title screen.

Call at some point at the end of the game (game over, completion, or other return to title). (Probably should be called automatically whenever returning to title, so should only call this if the game ends on a screen without a return to title.)

XBox One: Request to open the account picker UI.
The player's gametag should be displayed on the titlescreen together with an icon showing to press a certain button to change account. Pressing it should call this command.
